intro: Pinalia bogoriensis var. bogoriensis, commonly known as the Bogoriensis Pinalia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Myristicaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, evergreen leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Its botanical features include a woody stem, leathery foliage, and a distinctive floral structure. It is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
